oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Thomas "Stonewall" Jackson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General Thomas "Stonewall" Jackson portrait, framed with plaque. Inscription on plaque reads: "Presented By Mary Custis Lee Chapter, 17th Virginia Regiment, U.D.C., May 6, 1938." Image is a copy print of the famous "Chancellorsville Portrait," taken of Jackson in Spotsylvania County, Virginia, on April 26, 1863. The image was made just days before Jackson would be fatally wounded by his own troops during the Battle of Chancellorsville.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: General Thomas "Stonewall" Jackson
